		StaticText 'silence_end_match = silence_end_re.search(line)\n        total_duration_match = total_duration_re.search(line)\n        if silence_start_match:\n            chunk_ends.append(float(silence_start_match.group(\'start\')))\n            if len(chunk_starts) == 0:\n                # Started with non-silence.\n                chunk_starts.append(start_time or 0.)\n        elif silence_end_match:\n            chunk_starts.append(float(silence_end_match.group(\'end\')))\n        elif total_duration_match:\n            hours = int(total_duration_match.group(\'hours\'))\n            minutes = int(total_duration_match.group(\'minutes\'))\n            seconds = float(total_duration_match.group(\'seconds\'))\n            end_time = hours * 3600 + minutes * 60 + seconds\n\n    if len(chunk_starts) == 0:\n        # No silence found.\n        chunk_starts.append(start_time)\n\n    if len(chunk_starts) > len(chunk_ends):\n        # Finished with non-silence.\n        chunk_ends.append(end_time or 10000000.)\n\n    return list(zip(chunk_starts, chunk_ends))\n\n\ndef _makedirs(path):\n    """Python2-compatible version of ``os.makedirs(path, exist_ok=True)``."""\n    try:\n        os.makedirs(path)\n    except OSError as exc:\n        if exc.errno != errno.EEXIST or not os.path.isdir(path):\n            raise\n\n\ndef split_audio(\n    in_filename,\n    out_pattern,\n    silence_threshold=DEFAULT_THRESHOLD,\n    silence_duration=DEFAULT_DURATION,\n    start_time=None,\n    end_time=None,\n    verbose=False,\n):\n    chunk_times = get_chunk_times(in_filename, silence_threshold, silence_duration, start_time, end_time)\n\n    for i, (start_time, end_time) in enumerate(chunk_times):\n        time = end_time - start_time\n        out_filename = out_pattern.format(i, i=i)\n        _makedirs(os.path.dirname(out_filename))\n\n        logger.info(\'{}: start={:.02f}, end={:.02f}, duration={:.02f}\'.format(out_filename, start_time, end_time,\n            time))\n        _logged_popen(\n            (ffmpeg\n                .input(in_filename, ss=start_time, t=time)\n                .output(out_filename)\n                .overwrite_output()\n                .compile()\n            ),\n            stdout=subprocess.PIPE if not verbose else None,\n            stderr=subprocess.PIPE if not verbose else None,\n        ).communicate()\n\n\nif __name__ == \'__main__\':\n    kwargs = vars(parser.parse_args())\n    if kwargs[\'verbose\']:\n        logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG, format=\'%(levels): %(message)s\')\n        logger.setLevel(logging.DEBUG)'

step_data.thought:
I'm now viewing the split_silence.py example file for audio processing in the ffmpeg-python repository, which was the goal. The page shows the full source code of the script which demonstrates how to use ffmpeg-python to split audio files based on silence detection. 

The script includes functionality to:
1. Detect silence in audio files using FFmpeg's silencedetect filter
2. Split the audio into separate chunks at silence points
3. Process command line arguments for configuring silence threshold and duration
4. Output the split audio chunks to specified file patterns

The user wanted to view this example, and I've successfully navigated to it. Since I've accomplished the goal, I should let the user know that I've found the split_silence.py example they were looking for.

This example demonstrates how to use ffmpeg-python to detect silence in audio files and split them into separate chunks at silence points. You can see the full source code on the page, which includes functionality for configuring silence threshold, duration, and output file patterns.')
